Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlGreyMare
Reviews.Content: As stated, right off Taksim Square in a nice little neighborhood. Very quiet, elegant atmosphere. Short walk to good restaurants, nightlife, shopping and transportation. Desk staff helpful, in English. Breakfast had plenty of variety and it was well done. Elevators are tiny - factor that in for comings and goings. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for location and value”
Reviews.Author: Damian M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Central Palace twice now and it's difficult to fault. Agree very much with previous posts regarding location, quietness of hotel, good breakfast, excellent decor and helpful staff. It's amazing that this place is so close to Taksim Square but you are removed from the hustle and bustle pretty much immediately you hit Lamartin Place. Very comfortable beds, internet and cleanliness make this a really good hotel. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job. Beautifully.”
Reviews.Author: jacquesward
Reviews.Content: A well apportioned hotel that I found on for the money. Great location off Taksim Sq. and yet quiet. Friendly staff and a good breakfast to boot. Only a couple of minor negatives not worthy of mention on here. One thing though: they don't seem to have a "do not disturb" hanger for the door (or not one I could see).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: melissamaples
Reviews.Content: This is a concept hotel decorated in a modern version of late-Ottoman style. The overall vibe is elegant and luxurious. The location is amazing - not only is it a five-minute walk from Taksim and Istiklal, but the hotel's neighbourhood, Talimhane, is a fantastic area in its own right. There are several great restaurants and night spots within two blocks of The Central Palace, so even if you don't feel like going out-out one night, you can pop into Rouge bar across the street or Udonya on the corner and have a great meal or some drinks. As a female photographer travelling alone, I felt perfectly safe and comfortable walking around the neighbourhood alone, at night, with my camera out. I asked for a high floor, and was given room 901. Some (perhaps all) of the 9th-floor rooms have private terraces, and I believe 9 is the only floor with terraces (certainly the floors above me did not have them). It was snowing during my trip, so I can't say I particularly used the terrace much, but I can imagine it would be nice to sit out there in the spring or autumn. However, there's not much in the way of privacy, as those staying in upper-floor rooms can look out their windows and see what you're doing on your terrace. There go your plans for naked terrace dancing. 901 doesn't have a spectacular view, but you can see bits of skyline here and there. It's not a terrible view, either. The room was comfortable, and although I didn't have my own thermostat, the room always seemed to be a reasonable temperature. I slept very well in the bed. It was described as a king-sized bed, but I would say it was a large double or maybe a small queen-sized at most. Definitely not a king. Still, I was on my own, so it wasn't that big a deal in my case. I've seen others complaining that their jacuzzi didn't work... the one in 901 worked perfectly. It was a great way to warm up after coming in from the snow. Again, it's only large enough for one person, so if you're looking at the jacuzzi option as part of a romantic getaway, there's no way two people will fit in there (or three, if that's your thing - I'm not judging you, I'm just telling you there won't be much jacuzzi action). Nice big TV in the room with many international channels... personally I didn't come to Istanbul to watch TV, but if you're planning on spending a lot of time in the room, you won't be disappointed. The staff were very helpful and responded well to requests. Everyone I talked to spoke good English, I had no communication problems whatsoever. Food: I only took advantage of the included breakfast twice. I read reviews saying how great the selection is, but really I think it's made to look bigger than it actually is by the addition of eight million different kinds of bread. So if you like a lot of bread at breakfast, you'll be very happy. Unfortunately powdered NescafÃ© was the only drink resembling coffee, so I found myself going out to have breakfast at places where real coffee was served. I did also have room service one evening, and it was delicious - they sent up a club sandwich that was just phenomenal, and the price was similar to other restaurants in the area, so that was nice. Very pleased with that. In terms of my specific room, 901 worked out well for me. It's away from any other rooms, so it was pretty quiet, and I wasn't even aware of any other guests on my floor. As a solo traveller, the room was a perfect size. It would also be suitable for couples who like each other, but maybe a bit small for two people who are not in a romantic relationship (though if you stay in 901, feelings may develop between you two by the end of the second or third day). The only down side to the room is that it's right near the service lift, so there is some noise from housekeeping coming in and out of the lift with trolleys, and sometimes in the morning they failed to keep their voices down. Oh, speaking of housekeeping - my advice to you is to make liberal use of your Do Not Disturb sign. Otherwise the cleaning crew will just come barging in without warning at 8.30 in the morning. Once I started using the DND sign everything was fine, I would just take the sign off when I went out for the day, and the room would be clean when I came back in the late afternoon. Housekeeping does an excellent job, the room was spotless, but they are a bit overzealous when it comes to trying to gain access to the room. I almost felt like they were trying to catch me doing something. Overall, I had a great time. I do visit Istanbul semi-frequently, and I'd be very likely to stay at The Central Palace again. The location is perfect, the hotel is well-maintained, and the area is safe. Next time, though, I'll probably ask for a room on the opposite side of the hotel from the service lift, just to get that little bit of extra silence.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in a stone throw away from Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: ckanchan
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel which is just a stone throw away from Taksim Square. Main selling point can be its breakfast, which is amazing. It has got rooms with the view of Bosphorus Strait. Room is moderate and comfortable. Service is good enough. But hotel is far away from being a star hotel given its basic facilities - small and basic gym hall, no swimming pool. Frustrating thing in this hotel was lack of iron and iron board, which is expected in any business hotel. This hotel is ideal for leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Met All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: zam123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Central Palace Hotel the beginning of Sept. for 4 nights. Family of 4, with 2 rooms, adjacent to each other. The hotel is located a short walk from Taksim Square, where there is a lot of activity, shopping and restaurants. We had rooms with a balcony, with view of the city (partially blocked by some rooftops, but still nice) and a jacuzzi. The rooms were spacious, clean, and the beds were comfortable. The included breakfast buffet was ample in its offerings, and the quality was pretty good. They had everything from 3 types of yogurt, to fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, meats, cereals, etc. While we never had dinner there, we were all satisfied with the breakfast. The service staff was responsive to any needs. Bathrooms were large, with hairdryers, so there was no concern over having to charge an appliance. The front desk staff spoke English and was able to guide us. One of the doormen was especially friendly and gave us "language lessons" while we had our Turkish coffee outside at their cafe. We had no negative experiences here, and found it easy to get assistance and directions. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coober
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, got upgraded on arrival to a suite. The rooms were huge with all the bids and pieces you Would or could need. The beds are very comfortable And everything was spotless. Our room had a big balcony With great views over Istanbul. Itâ€™s a tourist hotel and the Atmosphere is according. We enjoyed the breakfast which was typical for the region. The hotel has got a restaurant, but we did notice an absence of Alcohol that might be seasonal. Taksim square is a 3-min walk; it leads to one of the longest Shopping malls in the world with restaurants and bars. The hotel staff was helpful and polite. Itâ€™s a comfortable Hotel, good location and close to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: bjorn83
Reviews.Content: The Central Palace Hotel is a quite nice hotel, but I never got the really nice feeling about it, it didn't feel very personal. The hotel is overall very clean and feels new. (!) Beware about the hotel description on Bookings.com or other sites. For example they promise balcony in every room - which is not true. LOCATION is very good, near the large shopping streets in Taksim area, but on a smaller and more quiet street. Nicer restaurants can be found just a couple of blocks away, smaller ones just nearby. Kiosk across the street. ROOMS are large with a large bathroom, incuding what is called a "mini-spa" - a combined shower and thub which can be closed and used as a steaming sauna. Mine didn't work unfortunatley. Rooms includes private bathroom, TV, desk, telephone, mini-bar, in-room-safe, very comfortable beds. BREAKFAST was a nice experience with varieties of fruits, vegetables, sweets, cheese, eggs, coffee/tea etc. SERVICE is of regular turkish quality for a hotel of this class. Don't expect the staff to give you a smile or something though (according to my translator this is typical turkish behavior - even if I didn't like it - apparantley it comes to respect for the guest). SAFETY 24 hour reception, monitored elevators and in-room-safe. NO ALCOHOL is served at this hotel, nore can be found in the minibar. + Location - quiet, but close to the city center. + Good condition - feels new and clean. + Full service for business meetings. - The so called "mini-spa" in each room was worn out totally. - Restaurant service, not much to offer on the menu and no alcohol. - Sour staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gelmoat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, service was outstanding, rooms are clean and welcoming, the bathrooms were a delight. The location in the middle of the Taksim district is handy to a range of restaurants and nightlife. Breakfast is varied with a really good range of local foods, which are tasty and worth giving a try, particularly liked the honey straight from the honeycomb. Cons: only 2 things that didn't please, first, rooms at the back of the hotel are subjected to an all night night club, the music reverberating through the room, this was on the 3rd floor might be better higher, no such problem at the front of the hotel (same floor). Second, the 'hot' food at breakfast was at best lukewarm and one day just cold.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: Goldy15
Reviews.Content: Central Palace was a great experince. We stayed in a Standart Room but it was just a first class suite with a great balcony. Furniture, sheets, bathroom, breakfast was amazing. For the first time after choosing a hotel from internet, I found the room much better than it was shown in the pics! Location is great so so close to all the attractions of Taksim. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: SofiaDi
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the first time and booked the hotel through booking.com for a 3 nights stay. We arrived very early in the morning and as the room was not yet available the front desk offerd us complimentary breakfast. Breakfast has got a large variety of both european and local dishes to please everyone. The dining area is spacious, and there is always someone there to help you. Rooms are big with a small lining room. King size beds are 2 singles put together, but that has not been a problem to us, as they are very comfortable with goose feather pillows. Bathroom had a jacuzzi and hot water at all times. The cleaniness of the hotel is of very high standard. Spottlesly clean both rooms and all common areas. Staff very helpful and english speaking, witch we found very rare fot Turkey! Wi-fi is available everywhere in the hotel with a password given from reception at the check in, free of charge. All in all we had a perfect stay, and we will be certainly staying there again the next time we will visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: lgreco67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Central Palace for 4 nights in late December 2010. The hotel is located on a pedestrian street off Taksim Square. Our room (901) was comfortable and clean, with a spacious bathroom and an equally spacious balcony overlooking the neighborhood. The weather in Istanbul during our stay was pleasantly warm (for December), and we slept with the balcony door open. We had no issues with street or other noise. The self-serve breakfast buffet offered a generous variety of typical western-type dishes as well as local items. There was something for everyone. The WiFi is available throughout the hotel; customers need to obtain an access password -- no charge -- from the front desk first. The hotel also offers free parking. Location wide, the hotel is situated 0.2 miles from Taksim Square and 0.25 miles from the top of the tony Istiklal Street. From the square visitors can take the new furnicular down to Cabatas and fro there the T1 line of the tram to the most popular destinations in the city. A convenience store is located immediately across the hotel's entrance. On the pedestrian street from the hotel to the square you can find also a currency exchange (one of the most fair priced ones we saw and used), a meticulous shoe polisher, and a cozy wine bar. All in all the Central Palace Hotel offered us with a clean, comfortable, and pleasant base from which we explored the imperial city. We will not hesitate to return to this hotel for our future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Klautchen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in September 2010 during a business trip. The rooms were really clean and the furnishings were fine, although to room was not too spacious. The hotel is situated in a traffic free street and seems quite quiet at first sight. Breakfast was quite generous. When we arrived, we were immediately asked to pay for the whole stay, which didn't please me at all. The receptionist's English was horrible and communication was not easy at all. However he managed to bill the money. Visa card didn't work. The concierge who brought the luggage to our rooms, didn't really want to leave the room and tried to demonstrate the most basic functionalities of the room (A/C, tap...) until I gave him a tip. The rooms were very noisy. I couldn't get any sleep as my room (on the back side of the hotel) was located on a floor where a family was making noise all night. Please note the acoustic insulation towards the corridor was really poor. Changing the room proved to be very very difficult. Only after repeated complaints, they changed my room. My colleague's room was located on the front side of the hotel, where live music from a bar next to the hotel made it impossible to get some sleep until nearly 2.30 Even if the situation improved after changing the rooms, we still endured some discomfort as the build-on building is under construction (as well as another construction site over the way). Please note that in Turkey works start early in the morning and usually continue untill after midnight. Nobody draw our attention to that fact when we booked the hotel. Finally, I would not recommend staying at this hotel, as there are probably much better hotels in the area, with much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place with big rooms, but misses the mark.”
Reviews.Author: JasoninNewtown
Reviews.Content: This place is quite interesting. The rooms are big with plenty of room to relax in, but the style and ambience is a little off the mark. A little too much effort has been put towards glitz rather than design or style and some elements of the hotel are now looking a little tired. The design is a little odd too. The breakfast area is located below street level with no natural light, and the main lounge is wedged into the back of the hotel. While clean and comfortable, it is quite garish. The hotel is in quite a sweet location, being quietly located in a traffic free area by Taksim Square. As noted in other reviews, there are two buildings being constructed in the vicinity, one immediately opposite, the other next door. Noise isn't really a problem as the windows are double glazed, however there is quite a lot of dust around and building materials strewn about, messing up an otherwise cute little street. I suggest avoid using the hotel computers as my private details were phished from my accounts from this hotel (not by answering an email, but directly through a website), so I think internet security is questionable here. While the service here was good, the feeling was a bit odd for my partner and I here. I think it caters more for a local or Arabic clientele. There are many other hotels in this nice little spot behind Taksim square so I suggest you put a little more time into researching those.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: nousjacob
Reviews.Content: If ur looking for 4 star luxury, this is the place for u! Huge comfortable rooms which are more like suites, top cleanliness, extremely friendly staff and manager, and tasty food. This hotel has got it all, and at very reasonable prices!!! When I go back to Turkey, I'm only staying there! Even though it's a 4* hotel, it can easily be rated 5*....a couple staying at 6* hotel even relocated to The Central Palace, and they said it was better!!

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a Palace !!! Ripped me off. More like a 3 *”
Reviews.Author: Bill255060
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice in general given its locality and palace like facade. I orginally booked a room for a couple for three days via booking.com at 605 Euros than 2 weeks later found that the actual website was 100 Euros cheaper. I called the hotel up and advised them of this and they advised me to cancel the booking. I emailed my travel agent pridetravel.com advising them of this and that I only want 2 days and she mentioned to me that I shouldnt worry and she will fix the bookings up for me as she has dealings with this hotel regularly. Upon arrival the receptionist said I had to pay the 605 Euros regardless. I said that everything had been taken care of and that it was supposed to be 505 Euros for 3 nights, though given that i was staying 2 nights it should be no more than 405 Euros. Wouldnt budge and said he has no idea who pridetravel.com was and if I didnt pay boking.com was charge t hem based on 605 Euros. Receptionist called pridetravel.com who was to no avail. I ended up paying the amount with disgust on how these crooks go on with their business. Also upon being escorted to our rooms we were told that the single beds were to be merged as one.. I refused on the spot! Startedggoetet very irate as the guy was telling us all the king size beds are two single bedsmocmbined. I scoffed at this and said i want a King size bed as described. In the end the managed to get this organised. Appauling. The hotels were over heated- couldnt really breathe. Breakfast was budget and the fatsf members dress was awful (pink polo tops with tight black pants) thought i was in some queer venue. Nothing besides the furnishing reprented a "Palace". The only true palace is KEMPINSKI - ohtugh cant afford it at 505 EUros a night in their standard room. Not happy....

Reviews.Title: “Really is a "palace."”
Reviews.Author: williedillo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending a conference because we wanted a location with more local flair than the conference hotel. It was definitely a great choice. Fantastic staff-to-guest ratio. The staff were available for everything we needed, even walking you to the post office to help mail a letter. Amazing breakfast buffet--included hot and cold items, big choice of pastries, fruits, cheeses, etc., etc. Staff even brought breakfast to our room with no extra charge as we had an early departure on the last day. Hotel is in a great location in a neighborhood of pedestrian streets close to Taksim Square. Construction noise from next door that some of the other reviews mention is there, but only from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Should not be an issue unless you're a late sleeper. Definitely recommend this hotel for business or for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ianchel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights whilst in Istanbul on business, very comfortable, large room - more of a suite really, with well-appointed bathroom, sitting area with sofa, two armchairs and desk, plus good sleeping area. Huge choice at breakfast buffet, decent and free WiFi service, helpful staff. Only downside was that there is currently a building site next door so there was some noise from that but the hotel cannot be blamed for that. Would definitely recommend this for a small, well-run and very well-located hotel in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: MauriceBakker
Reviews.Content: This marked our 15th stay in the Taksim area in Istanbul and also our first bad experience with a hotel. This hotel's official rating is 4-star, whilst it sells itself (i.e. through booking.com) as 5-star. It claims all rooms have LCD TV: they do not, they have conventional 4:3 TVs. Construction works next door to the hotel go on from early morning until 02:00 hours every day, including weekend. Works are scheduled to finish summer 2011. The work cost us 2 nights proper sleep, as they stopped at 2:00 hours and restarted at 07:00 hours. We experienced both A/C and wireless internet problems, one night our A/C blew hot air only. Room temperature was an unchangeable 28C. The morning of 23 May the receptionist told us they had switched the A/C off centrally, as they had received complaints that rooms were too cold. In fact, we heard the technical engineer state that the whole system was down, which we also heard from other guests. All in all: keep looking for another hotel. Oh and yes, this hotel requires payment in full upon arrival, which is also a first. It does however take any basis for reclamations out of your hand. Very clever indeed. The only thing the hotel does have in its favour is its incredibly friendly staff, but that unfortunately does not compensate at all.

Reviews.Title: “glad i picked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsdatsun
Reviews.Content: - early check in on sunday, note tourists usually leave on saturday so i assume rooms were empty from the night before. - found lowest price via kayak.com, room size was much larger and thus nicer then the nearby eresin best western, but also paid more. you have to work for the room, meaning my credit card would not go through until i informed my bank. - traffic noise was non-existent but there is a cheesy musician at a nearby hotel that likes to sings songs till midnight. 12 minute rendition of la bamba. still his music was much better then hearing horns and traffic and you should be sleeping through anything because of your long days of sight seeing and nightlife. - asked for room that did not smell like smoke and received that, i believe checking in on sunday helped - i would stay here again unless i had a first person recommendation for an even better hotel. - there is a supermarket within walking distance, ask the front desk for its location and avoid the hotel or the nearby bodegas for water and such. the water price difference was about .25 TL vs 4 TL. At a bodega you are told what it costs, thus it varies, at the supermarket the prices are listed. - vegan? http://www.parsifalde.com/ was nearby and a great choice, younger, local crowd so less chance of getting ripped off. that is a common theme in turkey. deal with older people and you have a better chance of getting ripped off. deal with younger people and you have a better chance of not getting ripped off. - yes to mass transit at taksim square, no to cabs. get a map and learn. no smoke on mass transit, smoke city in the cabs. - yes to havas bus to taskim square from airport, no to cabs - fitness center was a joke. - this was not spell checked. - ATMs, you do not swipe, you insert and retrieve at the end so be careful and don't forget your card. - obtaining a VISA, double check that you receive the correct change and stick up for yourself if you don't. That was nice first experience of the VISA teller trying to make some extra money. - covered bazaar. set your own price don't worry what they suggest. walk away when they say no and then they usually call you back and say OK. the place is huge and what you are buying is being sold by 50 other stores.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: ksayar
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, excellent location, very good service, but small hotel. I stayed 5 nights in The Central Palace, this is my 2nd time staying in this hotel, I arrived at 3:00 pm but the room was not ready, I waited m0re than half an hour, I was upset because of that, when I entered the room all that forgotten, the room was big & fantastic & luxury. Location: excellent location in Taksim area, the most beautiful area in Istanbul, you can find every thing you need there, restaurants, coffee shops, shops, & the subway is steps from the hotel. Recommended hotel for the persons who are looking for great room with great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lack of cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Madrid_2007
Reviews.Content: The location at Taskim Square is great. Close to the main shopping street and eating out areas. The hotel is a bit old, but quite nice; front desk is very friendly. Breakfast was ok, obviousely it is not Western style, but one cannot expect this I think. However, our room was not clean; when we entered it was not cleaned properly, but we did not say anything; but the following days the cleaning was very poor. A cup of tea we used did not get cleaned; the following day we used two cups, which were afterwards dirty and did not get cleaned. We needed to call management to get a cleaner send over. She cleaned and took cups and glasses away...but without replacing them. For that reason and only for that I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tigger210
Reviews.Content: would highly recommend the hotel. The staff is personal and helpful. We went in April 2009, and they helped us with recommendations/reservations for acitivities. We also had a birthday, adn the manager sent up pastries on the house. The hotel is a botique hotel - comfortable, nice rooms (Steam shower unit in washrooms), and clean. It was one of few that accomodates 3 people in one room and breaskfast was free. The hotel is also very close to the Taskim Square (the main sqaure in Istanbul) so you are only a 8-10 mintue walk to dining and hooka/tea or music.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem In Taxim”
Reviews.Author: mmcgrath1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights - Loved every minute - Staff could not do enough to help - we have twin daughters aged 11 and they want to go back there! Lovely cafe just off reception which has the best chocolate ever which we were given with cappuchino's - am now addicted! No bar (which I personally like) No Coke Fanta or other minerals as this hotel offers Healthy options - which I really like! Had a lovely breakfast every morning and our girls loved the pastries. Location is fantastic only 2 minute walk onto taxim square. Very safe and secure hotel and very quiet. Would recommend to any traveller family or not. Hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very big rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: oberontitania
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the central new aerea of the city. The rooms are big and clean. The staff is nice but a lot of them don' t speak proper english and have their rythms. I asked for the alarm in the morning and they forgot, fortunately I'm paranoic so i put another alarm clock on the phone... Very very very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, friendly place, definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: a_biermann
Reviews.Content: We visited Ankara for New Year 2009, and were very happy with the Central Palace. The staff is very helpful, the location is convenient, and the rooms are small but well equipped and very comfortable. We did not mind that they were small, there's so much to see in Istanbul, we only went back to the hotel to sleep. When we stayed in the hotel the restaurant was being refurbished, so I can not comment on this. The breakfast is very nice. Did not try the fitness club and hammam. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ORS_4
Reviews.Content: Great location - 1 min walk from Taskin Square , but still quiet. very good breakfast, and very nice rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us- Indian Vegetarians”
Reviews.Author: Medapati
Reviews.Content: Hi We are an Indian Vegetarian couple who have stayed during end July'08-Aug'08 at this hotel for 4 days. We taught them to cook Indian vegetarian food and they are quite helpful and couple of them speak English. Front office and the breakfast service guys were very good. Wireless internet was a BOON! LOCATION IS JUST AMAZING - although you have many hotels in the same location (Taksim), which is a centre point. Tram, Bus, Metro and Funiculer are all walkable form the hotel. Musafir, Indian restaurant is right behin the hotel. Initially we had a bad experience as we had to wait for 3 hours to get our room. However, the staff and the room made up for that. Room (ours was on 9th floor) was spacious and clean and the balcony opened outside (though not a great Highly recommend this hotel, though on the first sight it doesn't appear so great. More for service, cleanliness, location and food.

Reviews.Title: “Indulging and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: labadim
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel. The rooms are very spacious, very nicely decorated and comfortable. The bed is enormous! The bathroom is large with a very nice jaccuzzi (whirlpool bath). Breakfast is plentiful and tasty, and the staff is very friendly and cooperative. Location is superb, just behind the corner to Taksim square, which is the center of new Istanbul, just 5 minutes of leisurely walk to Istiklal street where numerous restaurants and nice shops are located. We had a great stay at this hotel and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mslrfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and we traveled with another couple and we all loved this hotel. From the moment you entered you felt the richness of the decor and yet it was very warm and inviting. The rooms very very large and the bathrooms were amazing, especially for Europe. Breakfast was wonderful and the staff ratio to guests seemed to be very extensive. Always available to service you from the chamber maids to the front desk. The only negative we had was that the night staff at the desk didn't speak or seem to understand English clearly but still managed to communicate just fine. I have no complaints an hope to return to Istanbul as we loved the city and would definitely stay here again. and certainly reccomend it.

HotelInfo.Name: The Central Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lamartin Caddesino No18 | Taksim, Istanbul 34037, Turkey
